content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The target structure consists of multiple colored building blocks arranged in a specific configuration. There are two identical structures shown in the image - one on the left appears to be a simpler version, and one on the right is the complete structure.

Focusing on the complete structure (right side):
- The structure has 3 layers in total
- It uses 7 blocks: 2 green cubes, 2 blue cubes, 2 yellow half-cylinders, and 1 red U-shaped block
- There's also a yellow rectangular block that serves as a bridge on the second layer

### Spatial Relationships:
- Bottom layer: A green cube and blue cube are placed side by side with two yellow half-cylinder blocks in front of them
- Middle layer: A yellow rectangular block is placed horizontally across the top of the green and blue cubes
- Top layer: A red U-shaped block sits on top of the yellow rectangular block

## Selected Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:
- Green cube (index 7)
- Blue cube (index 6)
- Yellow half-cylinder (index 13) - used twice
- Yellow rectangular block (index 9)
- Red U-shaped block (index 3)

## Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 7
    Step2: Move block with index 6
    Step3: Move block with index 13
    Step4: Move block with index 13
    Step5: Move block with index 9
    Step6: Move block with index 3
}
```

This assembly sequence builds the structure from bottom to top, starting with the foundation cubes, then adding the front half-cylinders, placing the yellow rectangular bridge, and finally positioning the red U-shaped block on top.
